description: This foundation-level studio course introduces the aesthetic, conceptual, and technical foundations
of three-dimensional art-making and ways three-dimensional media inform the creation and
understanding of art in cultural contexts.  Students explore the form and space of three-dimensional
images through a wide variety of materials and media.  The course emphasizes strategies for
idea generation.  Students engage in dynamic activity, spirited investigation, and thoughtful
creative expression.  Materials fee.  Offered each semester.
